page.title: 19TRADE
page.content: Trade in Birtley ranges from a number of small businesses such as D.I.Y. shops, hairdressers, take-away food shops, and newsagents/confectioners to larger scale food stores (Supermarket) and Banks. Whilst larger industrial complexes have suffered as a result of the recession, the smaller shops appear to have coped fairly well, with little evidence of the closure. Indeed several second hand shops giving D.H.S.S. estimates have sprung up in the town to provide a service for the people who through redundancy have little money available to spend. It is probably because of the financial limitations, that there are few fashionable clothes shops, people instead spend their money on essentials which could explain the preponderance of food shops.
